content.question: Based on this information, which of the following functions is a better model for the amount of water used each day, measured in hundreds of gallons?

choices.label: <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 5 sin open parentheses 0.8 open parentheses t plus 10 close parentheses close parentheses plus 25"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>0.8</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn></math>

<math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals 5 sin open parentheses 0.8 open parentheses t plus 2 close parentheses close parentheses plus 33"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>0.8</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>33</mn></math>

<math alttext="k open parentheses t close parentheses equals 5 sin open parentheses 6.4 open parentheses t plus 2 close parentheses close parentheses plus 25"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>6.4</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn></math>

<math alttext="m open parentheses t close parentheses equals 40 sin open parentheses 0.8 open parentheses t plus 2 close parentheses close parentheses plus 25"><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>40</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>0.8</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals 5 sin open parentheses 0.8 open parentheses t plus 2 close parentheses close parentheses plus 33"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>0.8</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>33</mn></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
